intro: Draconia henriettae, commonly known as the Henrietta's Dragonroot, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers and thick, fleshy leaves adapted to arid conditions. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its unique, spiral-like arrangement of leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
